meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being viviparous.
meanings.sent1: The viviparity of mammals allows them to give birth to live young.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the viviparity of certain fish species to understand their reproductive process.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper joked that the viviparity of the snakes made them the ultimate helicopter parents.
meanings.sent4: In the world of nature, the viviparity of seahorses is truly a marvel to behold.
meanings.sent5: The documentary showcased the viviparity of kangaroos in a visually stunning way.

meanings.definition: The reproductive method in which offspring develop inside the body of the parent and are born alive.
meanings.sent1: The viviparity of humans is a distinguishing feature compared to egg-laying animals.
meanings.sent2: Sharks exhibit viviparity, giving birth to fully formed pups instead of laying eggs.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit humorously portrayed the challenges of viviparity in a family of penguins.
meanings.sent4: The concept of viviparity in nature is like a magical journey of life within life.
meanings.sent5: The textbook explained the process of viviparity in a clear and engaging manner.
